message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CR, cs.SE. 

The paper deals with scholarly plagiarism in the form of reuse of explicit citation sentences in scientific research articles, which is a common practice in computer science. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including digital libraries (cs.DL), information retrieval (cs.IR), computational linguistics (cs.CL), cryptography and security (cs.CR), and software engineering (cs.SE). However, given that the paper focuses on analyzing a large bibliographic text dataset from computer science, we believe that cs.DL and cs.IR are the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.CL, cs.CR, and cs.SE.
